item.title: Deep pothole x2, 14th December
item.description:
Two very deep potholes, possibly deeper than a tennis ball and almost the size of a dinner plate so these need fixing very quickly. These haven’t been reported I don’t think before and they are positioned between St George’s Road and the pedestrian crossing. These are not the same ones as the pedestrian crossing potholes which are also so bad.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bayshill Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public footpath surface rendered impassable by deep slurry and standing water, 14th December
item.description:
Public footpath near Coopers Hill, Gloucester, running immediately alongside a cow barn. The path surface is covered by approximately 1–1.5 feet of cow slurry/manure with a large standing puddle, making it unsafe and impassable without leaving the route. No temporary diversion or clearance is in place. Issue observed today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witcombe Roman Villa, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole road needs re surfacing as it is in dyer need, 14th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Fairhaven Avenue, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: High Illuminated Bollard Light Out, 13th December
item.description:
On the central traffic island on London Road.nr its junction with Woodgate Close, Charlton Kings PS this is on the far side of the closed bridge on A40 London Road, so assess through central Charlton Kings, not in rush hours or start or ends of school days; or alternatively via Andoversford.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Cheltenham
